intents.description: Visible linear fractures, fissures, or cracks in concrete, asphalt, pavement, walls, or bridges.
clip_text_prompts: a close-up photograph of cracked asphalt pavement showing linear fractures and surface deterioration
concrete surface with visible hairline cracks and fissures spreading across the structure
damaged road pavement with dark branching crack patterns and weathered texture
infrastructure inspection image showing structural cracks in a bridge or wall surface
gray concrete slab with visible split lines, gaps, and surface discontinuities
deteriorated sidewalk or parking lot surface displaying multiple crack networks
close-up view of aged cement or asphalt showing thermal cracks and load-induced damage
road surface damage with pothole edges, expansion joint cracks, and linear fractures
high-resolution inspection photograph of cracked infrastructure requiring maintenance
detailed surface defect image showing crack propagation and structural deterioration
civil engineering documentation photo capturing concrete fractures and structural failures
macro photography of pavement cracks with visible texture discontinuities and openings
infrastructure monitoring image for damage assessment and maintenance planning
photograph documenting aging infrastructure with visible crack networks and deterioration

this_intent_visual_traits: linear or branching dark lines on uniform surfaces
geometric patterns on concrete or asphalt
texture discontinuities in built materials
narrow gaps or openings in solid surfaces
other_intent_visual_traits: distinct object boundaries with diverse shapes
recognizable scene elements like furniture or vegetation
coherent objects rather than surface defects

input_requirements.notes: Typically high-resolution images of infrastructure surfaces; may be grayscale but often stored as RGB.

expected_output.schema_notes: Bounding boxes [x1,y1,x2,y2] or pixel masks indicating crack regions; confidence scores per detection.

intents.description: Aerial or satellite imagery showing buildings with visible damage after disasters: collapsed roofs, debris, rubble, structural deformation.
intents.bart_description: overhead or aerial scene with buildings showing visible disaster damage such as collapsed structures, missing roofs, rubble and debris fields, and rescue context
clip_text_prompts: aerial photograph of damaged buildings with collapsed roofs and debris scattered around the structures
overhead view of disaster zone showing destroyed buildings, rubble piles, and structural failures
satellite image of post-earthquake or post-hurricane building damage with missing roofs and walls
drone imagery capturing flattened structures and demolished buildings from above
bird's eye view of damaged urban area with visible building destruction and emergency response
orthophoto showing building damage assessment with intact versus collapsed structures
aerial disaster monitoring image displaying rooftop damage, debris fields, and structural deformation
overhead building damage classification imagery with visible catastrophic impact on infrastructure
high-altitude aerial reconnaissance of post-disaster building destruction and debris patterns
multi-temporal satellite comparison showing pre- and post-disaster structural damage to buildings
emergency response aerial documentation of collapsed buildings and disaster zone assessment
building-level damage classification from aerial platform distinguishing destruction severity
drone-based orthophoto mosaic showing building footprints and damage patterns after natural disaster
overhead damage extent mapping for disaster response and infrastructure recovery planning

this_intent_visual_traits: buildings with visible structural damage or collapse
debris, rubble, or missing roofs
aerial or overhead perspective of damaged structures
contextual signs of disaster impact or rescue presence
other_intent_visual_traits: intact satellite imagery of land use or vegetation

input_requirements.notes: Typically aerial or satellite RGB images; may include multi-temporal pairs (pre/post).

expected_output.schema_notes: Per-building damage class: no damage, minor, major, destroyed; may include bounding boxes or polygons.

intents.description: Everyday objects, people, animals, vehicles, furniture in natural or urban scenes; general purpose detection.
clip_text_prompts: a photograph of people, cars, and everyday objects in an urban street scene
indoor scene with furniture, laptops, books, and household items on tables and shelves
outdoor park setting showing dogs, bicycles, benches, and people walking around
typical living room or office environment with chairs, desks, computers, and various objects
street photography capturing vehicles like cars, buses, trucks, and motorcycles on the road
everyday photo with recognizable objects such as bottles, cups, phones, backpacks, and bags
natural scene with animals like cats, dogs, birds, or horses in their typical environments
common indoor or outdoor setting featuring multiple object categories and everyday items
crowded scene with many distinct people and vehicles visible at different depths
retail or public environment showing multiple object instances for localization and counting
general-purpose photography suitable for standard object detection benchmarks and datasets
everyday life documentation with clear object visibility for recognition and classification
mixed environment combining indoor elements and outdoor views with diverse object types
photograph capturing common objects of interest for automated detection and classification tasks

this_intent_visual_traits: distinct objects with clear boundaries
people, animals, vehicles, furniture
everyday items in typical contexts
multiple object categories visible
other_intent_visual_traits: holistic scene classification without object focus

input_requirements.notes: Standard RGB images; no volumetric or medical formats.

expected_output.schema_notes: Bounding boxes [x1,y1,x2,y2], class labels, confidence scores per detected object.

intents.description: Pixel-level masks for objects; instance or semantic segmentation of anything in the image with precise boundaries.
clip_text_prompts: pixel-perfect segmentation masks showing precise object boundaries and silhouettes in the image
instance segmentation with detailed contours separating foreground objects from background
semantic segmentation map displaying pixel-level classification of all regions in the scene
fine-grained object masks with exact outlines for people, vehicles, furniture, and other items
segmentation output showing individual object instances with accurate boundary delineation
pixel-wise labeling that precisely partitions the image into object regions and background areas
detailed object extraction masks capturing the exact shape and area of each element
panoptic segmentation combining instance and semantic masks for comprehensive scene understanding
high-resolution mask generation for object isolation and background removal tasks
precise boundary annotation for each visible object with pixel-level accuracy
semantic region partitioning separating distinct object and background regions cleanly
instance-aware segmentation capturing individual object outlines and morphological details
object mask generation suitable for object extraction, counting, and area measurement
segmentation annotation suitable for training computer vision models and dataset creation

this_intent_visual_traits: pixel-level masks for everyday objects
natural scenes, people, vehicles, furniture
RGB images without medical or volumetric context
instance or semantic masks for general objects
other_intent_visual_traits: medical imagery with organs or tissues (medical segmentation)

input_requirements.notes: Standard RGB images; SAM can operate with or without prompts (points, boxes).

expected_output.schema_notes: Pixel masks (binary or multi-class), instance IDs, confidence scores, polygon contours.

outdoor landscape scene showing natural environments like parks, forests, beaches, or mountains

architectural scene showing building exteriors, plazas, bridges, or constructed environments
natural outdoor environment with trees, water bodies, sky, and landscape features
identifiable place or location category with distinct spatial context and scene layout
wide-angle photograph capturing the overall spatial structure and context of the environment
holistic scene composition suitable for place recognition and location classification
environmental setting documentation for indoor-outdoor classification and place categorization
spatial context photography emphasizing architectural or natural elements defining the location
scene type identification photograph for Places365 benchmark or similar place classification task
photograph capturing dominant environmental features for scene understanding and place analysis

this_intent_visual_traits: holistic scene view with spatial context
identifiable place or room type
architectural or environmental layout

expected_output.schema_notes: Scene category label (e.g., bedroom, park), confidence scores across 365 place classes.

intents.description: Frontal or lateral chest X-ray; detect multiple pathologies (pneumonia, effusion, cardiomegaly, etc.) in grayscale or pseudo-RGB radiograph.

diagnostic chest radiograph suitable for automated pathology detection and classification
2D radiographic projection of thorax for clinical assessment of cardiopulmonary status

expected_output.schema_notes: Multi-label probabilities for 14 pathologies (atelectasis, cardiomegaly, effusion, infiltration, mass, nodule, pneumonia, pneumothorax, consolidation, edema, emphysema, fibrosis, pleural thickening, hernia).

meta.description: Expanded 14-intent taxonomy for multimodal vision router (YOLO + Florence + CLIP + BART).
